item.title: Lightning Talks - Thursday morning
item.description:
Description

Lightning Talks - Thursday morning

  • 00:00 - Jason Boyer: Multi DB Routing
  • 05:20 - Vicky Tuite: PyStar
  • 08:55 - Katie Cunningham: Django Explorer
  • 11:45 - Shawn Milo: You Should Contribute to Django
  • 16:00 - Graham King: Psychology for your web app
  • 21:30 - Tobias McNulty: FabulAWS
  • 27:00 - Harris Lapiroff: Pipetter
  • 31:05 - Tim White: wtfawd?
  • 33:50 - Matt Lauber: Multiforms: A simple tool for managing multiple forms
  • 38:55 - Kenneth Love: The dumb and lazy guide to class-based views
  • 42:30 - Todd Davies: Let's talk about "control by users"
  • 47:40 - Sebastian Serrano: backbone.js with django and tastypie
  • 51:15 - ?: Stackato
  • 56:00 - Steve Ivy: Activity streams
  • 59:15 - Kenneth Love and Chris Jones: There's always money in the Banana(-py) Stand! (Banana-Py)
  • 1:00:46 - Brian Davis: Static analysis in Emacs (emacs-psa)
  • 1:03:55 - ?: Sitting on your butt and letting your ideas happen without you
  • 1:06:35 - Mjumbe Poe: django-model-blocks
item.dc:creator: Jason Boyer

item.title: The development process of Python
item.description:
Summary

[EuroPython 2011] Ezio Melotti - 24 June 2011 in "Track Ravioli "

Description

Python is an open source language, where everyone can contribute, and thanks to Mercurial now it's even easier. With this talk I want to unveil what happens "behind the scenes" of CPython and how you can get involved and be part of the open source community that allows Python to be one of the most popular programming languages.

I will explain:

  • what is the workflow of the CPython development;
  • how to get a clone of Python;
  • how to use Mercurial to do all the most common operations;
  • what is the structure of the main CPython repository;
  • what other are repositories are used;
  • how to use the bug tracker to report and find bugs;
  • how to use remote Mercurial repos to contribute code;
  • what tools are used;
  • how to get in touch with the core developers;
  • what are the plans for the future.
item.dc:creator: Ezio Melotti
